summary: The document is a memorandum dated 28 September 1961, detailing the employment of Joseph S. Piccolo with the CIA from 4 February 1957 until his resignation on 4 October 1961. It outlines his use of nominal state cover in Mexico and Department of the Army cover at Headquarters, along with instructions for employment disclosure, travel details, and his forwarding address post-resignation in Ft. Lauderdale, Florida, where he was to be employed at the 21st Tactical Fighter Sq., Andrews AFB. The memorandum was intended for inclusion in Piccolo's personnel and security files.
key_findings: Joseph S. Piccolo was employed by the CIA from 1957 to 1961.
He utilized nominal state cover in Mexico and Department of the Army cover at Headquarters.
Specific instructions were provided to Piccolo regarding the disclosure of his employment and travel details to maintain confidentiality of assignments.
After resigning, Piccolo's forwarding address was in Ft. Lauderdale, Florida, with new employment at the 21st Tactical Fighter Sq., Andrews AFB.
The memorandum was prepared for Piccolo's personnel and security files.
